intro: Palicourea magna, commonly known as the giant palicourea, is a climbing shrub native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous tiny seeds. Palicourea magna is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests.
